str2: And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.
Probably akin to phaino through the idea of disclosure; a tone; by implication, an address, saying or language.
Much, many; often.
From aggello; a messenger; especially an 'angel'; by implication, a pastor.
And, even, also, namely.
An animal, living creature. Neuter of a derivative of zao; a live thing, i.e. An animal.
And, even, also, namely.
Comparative of presbus; older; as noun, a senior; specially, an Israelite Sanhedrist or Christian 'presbyter'.
A circle, ring. As if dative case of kuklos; i.e. In a circle, i.e. all around.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From thrao; a stately seat; by implication, power or a potentate.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A number, total. From airo; a number.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A myriad, group of ten thousand, a ten thousand. From murioi; a ten-thousand; by extension, a 'myriad' or indefinite number.
A myriad, group of ten thousand, a ten thousand. From murioi; a ten-thousand; by extension, a 'myriad' or indefinite number.
And, even, also, namely.
A thousand, the number one thousand. From chilioi; one thousand.
A thousand, the number one thousand. From chilioi; one thousand.
